message_1:
Calculate the standard enthalpy change of reduction for the reaction: 
Fe2O3(s) + 3H2(g) -> 2Fe(s) + 3H2O(l) 
Given: 
Standard enthalpy of formation (ΔHf°) of Fe2O3(s) = -822 kJ/mol 
Standard enthalpy of formation (ΔHf°) of H2O(l) = -286 kJ/mol 
Standard enthalpy of fusion (ΔHfus) of Fe(s) = 13.81 kJ/mol 
Standard enthalpy of vaporization (ΔHvap) of H2(g) = 0.449 kJ/mol 
Standard enthalpy of formation (ΔHf°) of H2(g) = 0 kJ/mol
message_2:
To calculate the standard enthalpy change of reduction for the reaction, we can use the following equation:

ΔH° = Σ ΔHf°(products) - Σ ΔHf°(reactants)

For the products:
2 mol Fe(s) + 3 mol H2O(l)

For the reactants:
1 mol Fe2O3(s) + 3 mol H2(g)

Now, we can substitute the given values into the equation:

ΔH° = [2 * 0 (ΔHf° of Fe) + 3 * (-286) (ΔHf° of H2O)] - [1 * (-822) (ΔHf° of Fe2O3) + 3 * 0 (ΔHf° of H2)]

ΔH° = [0 + (-858)] - [(-822) + 0]

ΔH° = -858 + 822

ΔH° = -36 kJ/mol

The standard enthalpy change of reduction for the reaction is -36 kJ/mol.
